event.body: We start the 2014 LocationTech Tour in the Golden Gate City. This evening event starts with a happy hour and features speakers from Boundless, Planet Labs, Red Hat, Twitter, and more.
We celebrate one year of successes with an evening of good food, drinks, and short presentations highlighting the innovative new technology projects hosted at LocationTech.

Please join us in Toulouse, the heart of the aerospace industry in Europe. This event features presentations and demos of technology pushing the state of the art for mobile mapping as well as advanced data version control and what that means for work flows.
Co-located with the OGC Technical Meeting in Geneva, this evening event is a chance to learn more about technology pushing the state of the art for visualization on mobile devices and data work flow.
Co-located with the OGC Technical Meeting in Calgary, this evening event features presentations and demos of advanced open source geospatial software.
A social evening of fun, mapping and technology.

Hamburg's LocationTech event will be a conference-style speaker series featuring technical talks/demos on the convergence of open source and geospatial.
Interested to present your project : register here as a speaker.
Co-located with the Envision Geomatics conference in Gatineau, a suburb of Ottawa, this 3 day event provides a thorough overview of open source geospatial technologies.

The AvidGeo Conference, part of the LocationTech Tour again this year, is a great chance to hear about geospatial technology and get hands on workshop time with current tools. The morning of the conference will consist of 30 minute talks and the afternoon will consist of 60 minute workshop sessions that will expose attendees to a hands-on look at the technology.

Philadelphia's LocationTech event will be a conference-style speaker series featuring technical talks on the convergence of open source and geospatial. This will also be a GeoPhilly event hosted by Azavea. A social happy hour will follow.
This event is a code sprint hosted by Azavea. This event provides an opportunity to work on LocationTech project code with experts.
A fitting completion of the 2014 Tour arriving back in Washington D.C. for an evening discussing new technologies and concepts advancing the state of the art in our industry.

Organized during FOSS4G week in Portland, this LocationTech Birds of a Feather Meetup is a chance to meet members, project developers, entrepreneurs, and other interesting people for an enjoyable evening of good food, drinks, and camraderie.

This event is a special collaboration between the LocationTech, Science, and Internet of Things (IoT) working groups. It will present advanced open source technologies being used to push the state of the art in these domains.
Hosted by the University of Toronto, this event is a focus on high performance geoprocessing and big data.
